section.text: Thanks, Mike. Operator, let's open the call for Q&A please.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Marci Ryvicker", "section_number": 0, "uuid": "8cafedd6-ec93-421c-a56d-0581052ad56a", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President, Investor Relations at Comcast"}

section.text: Thank you. We will now begin the question-and-answer session. [Operator Instructions] Our first question comes from Ben Swinburne with Morgan Stanley. Please go ahead.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 1, "uuid": "1822f75b-fcf7-4576-b183-6c88afb6feb7", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: Thank you. Good morning. Brian, I'd love to hear from you, how you're thinking about capital allocation, given just we've had this significant increase in cost-of-capital and investors are highly focused on where you guys are making your big bets in the business. How are you thinking about priorities, including M&A just given the backdrop we're in right now and some of the macro concerns we see ahead of us?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Benjamin Swinburne", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "2f814cd3-bdd0-4023-9f18-35d81b037202", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morgan Stanley"}

section.text: And along those lines, I mean one of the big announcements you guys -- and you talked about it in your prepared remarks, is into the Cable Network around DOCSIS 4. So, I'd love to hear from Dave what are the capital needs to get where you want to go over the next few years? Is that going to drive up CapEx? Is there an argument to spend the money faster to help the business differentiate better in the market? How do you think about the benefits to the business from getting to DOCSIS 4.0 over the next few years? Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Benjamin Swinburne", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "2f814cd3-bdd0-4023-9f18-35d81b037202", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morgan Stanley"}

section.text: Thanks, Ben. Let me just start and then kick it to, Mike. Given his new job, I'm looking for him to help on those capital allocation questions quite a bit. But I think the bar is the highest it's been in terms of M&A. Obviously, cost-of-capital has gone up and we think our stock is attractive and have increased the buyback, as Mike just said. We announced both in actions this quarter and in our Board authorization. So, we feel really great about that opportunities to look at things but we really like the Company we've got. Mike, why don't you do that, and Dave can talk about DOCSIS 4.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 3, "uuid": "56596cd3-6bb2-4dc6-953b-603fc1d56206", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: Sure, Ben, thanks and good morning. So, I just step back a little bit and think about what we do with capital through the lens of start with how we generate capital, so if you look at this quarter you see we had record margins in the Cable business, 45%; we had record profits in the Theme Parks business and record profits in the Studio businesses, so just to call out a few examples. And those are the result of us putting tremendous energy and effort and capital back in our businesses.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "cf841937-d24d-46fe-813e-019ebe8a30d9", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: So, when we talk about the formula that we've got, it's always with a view to have growth opportunities in our existing businesses. so we can put capital to work and in the future get the kind of results we've had now on the back of the investments that we have had in the past.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "cf841937-d24d-46fe-813e-019ebe8a30d9", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: So. priority one right now is to invest in the network. I'll let Dave expand on that. But we've got a great path to symmetrical multi-gig through DOCSIS 4.0 in a reasonable time frame at reasonable cost inside the envelope that we've talked about, about 11% CapEx intensity. We've got Theme Parks with Epic Universe well underway. We've got investment in streaming with Peacock that Jeff will talk about. So, we're excited about putting money, first and foremost, back into our businesses to drive great results for years to come. And so, that's the virtuous cycle that you see.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "cf841937-d24d-46fe-813e-019ebe8a30d9", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: So, that's step one, put money back in the business; two, keep a strong balance sheet. We get asked a lot about that, but I think when you look at the environment we're in, I think we're happy to have what I would say is the best, strongest balance sheet in the business. So, I think that's piece two.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "cf841937-d24d-46fe-813e-019ebe8a30d9", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: And then piece three, and I'm very happy with the results Brian talked about, $9.5 billion of buybacks year-to-date, $5 billion-ish run rate of dividends for the year, we were asked the questions over the last several years, are we committed and when we got back to leverage targets would we be able to -- would we be committed -- are we committed to returning capital to shareholders. And we said all along that it was our highest priority to get back to that place, but to do it in the context of the formula I just described.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 5, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "cf841937-d24d-46fe-813e-019ebe8a30d9", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: So, I think hopefully everybody has confidence that we understand that formula and you all understand that formula. So, as you look ahead on capital return, I think we're going be guided as we've been in the recent past by our leverage will stay around 2.4x leverage while doing all the things I just described and that'll dictate ample amount of return to shareholders. So, that's that.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 6, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "cf841937-d24d-46fe-813e-019ebe8a30d9", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: And then I think on the M&A side of things,, it's -- we like the business we have. With all the opportunities we have in the businesses and the stock where it is, I see us very focused on the opportunities in the business and -- as I just described.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 7, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "cf841937-d24d-46fe-813e-019ebe8a30d9", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: So, I'll give David -- it over to Dave for DOCSIS 4.0.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 8, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "cf841937-d24d-46fe-813e-019ebe8a30d9", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: Thanks, Mike, and hello, Ben. So one of the -- our game plans have always been to consistently invest in the network. I think our network is one of our core strengths. We have this ubiquitous footprint and we serve every segment that it would -- I think a great round of broadband tiers. So -- and we're able to do things like we just announced, the 20 million customers just had a speed upgrade we've been doing this consistently.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 5, "uuid": "e8d88aac-8f95-46b4-90e8-3fc0dfa9005b", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So, the initiatives that we have are -- it's a great roadmap starting with what we've talked about, mid-split capability and DOCSIS and that rolls to DOCSIS 4.0 and also, we're going to play often, so just adding more passings. So, we're anticipating longer-term growth in broadband, real opportunities in every segment. And so, in terms of mid-splits, we're rolling it out right now, delivering multi-gig download speeds and upload speeds that are 200 megabits to 300 megabits, which is up to 10x faster than our current upload speed.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 5, "uuid": "e8d88aac-8f95-46b4-90e8-3fc0dfa9005b", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So, will be deployed to 20% of our footprint by the end of this year and will be by the end of '25 it will be serving the vast majority of our footprint with mid-split. And then on the back of this, to DOCSIS 4.0, will be in the market but in the second half of 2003 with multi-gig symmetrical speeds, as Mike mentioned, and the vast majority of our footprint will begin the process in '25.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 5, "uuid": "e8d88aac-8f95-46b4-90e8-3fc0dfa9005b", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So we do all of this with a CapEx intensity of around 11% and we're able to do this as we virtualize key parts of the network, it's a part of the roadmap to be able to do this. So, we'll have the most effective and efficient, I think, game plan in regards to network. And we're also going to limit the amount of CPE change-outs that are required. Whether it's video set-top boxes, gateways, we're able to just focus on serving every segment to fit effectively and efficiently.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 5, "uuid": "e8d88aac-8f95-46b4-90e8-3fc0dfa9005b", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So -- and what we're seeing, it's early, but we really like the customer experience benefits as we do this. But it's a really effective, very efficient roadmap. We're real pleased with our position to serve ubiquitously. I think by the way one of the big reasons why our -- we have near-record low churn, because our network is so solid.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 5, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 5, "uuid": "e8d88aac-8f95-46b4-90e8-3fc0dfa9005b", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: Thanks, everyone.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Benjamin Swinburne", "section_number": 6, "uuid": "523288fc-65d5-452e-b1b3-b37bedf2653e", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Morgan Stanley"}

section.text: Thanks, Ben. Next question please. Our next question comes from Doug Mitchelson from Credit Suisse. Please go ahead.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Marci Ryvicker", "section_number": 7, "uuid": "3a2bfd97-0a13-46cb-9b18-82f1b399774a", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President, Investor Relations at Comcast"}

section.text: Thanks so much. One for Mike, one for Dave. Congrats, Mike on the promotion. On the hurricane commentary for the 4Q net losses of broadband customers, is there any sizing or context for how the big the hurricane impact might be and whether ex-hurricane there would have been positive broadband net-adds for 4Q if I heard your comment correctly?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Doug Mitchelson", "section_number": 8, "uuid": "113b31b2-3cac-4be7-ae54-cdfb1d1e49bb", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Credit Suisse"}

section.text: And then for Dave, I just wanted to follow-up on DOCSIS 4.0 from Ben's question. I'm just curious, how would you articulate the end-state for DOCSIS 4.0-based network or node versus a fiber-based one? There's a lot of debate as to whether DOCSIS will be fully competitive on speeds and latency, particularly from a consumer perception basis. And is there any other benefit to an upgraded plan that we should consider relative to your operations today as you push forward these upgrades? Thank you both.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Doug Mitchelson", "section_number": 8, "uuid": "113b31b2-3cac-4be7-ae54-cdfb1d1e49bb", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Credit Suisse"}

section.text: Thanks, Doug. I'll let Dave really chime in. It's his team that's doing amazing work to get the network back up in Southwest Florida. Those are our markets. They were -- like Brian said earlier, our plant was the one hit hardest. It will be in the tens of thousands, but we're still working on the numbers in terms of homes that -- residences that won't turn back on. But we'll tell you what the number is when we get through it during the course of this quarter. And you can look-back at some prior hurricane experiences. It's typically tens and tens of thousands.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael J. Cavanagh", "section_number": 9, "uuid": "c61e4f40-96b1-46e8-936c-13ff286242c8", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Financial Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: Hey, Doug. So, let me piggyback on what Mike was saying in regards to the hurricane, really remarkable, we have just amazing teammates that respond to these moments. It's just incredible. I think it's a testament how we run the business. We run it very locally and so our teammates live and work-in these communities which we serve and so they were positioned to get to worked almost immediately, even when in some cases they're personally dealing what situations. So, we've started rebuilding and repairing right away. It's a pretty big area of impact for us in Florida. It's about -- in terms of just sizing it seasonally, it's about half of our seasonal activity that was impacted by the hurricane.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 10, "uuid": "cea2302c-b75e-4556-9f70-3c9194ba8c29", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So when you look at it, I think Mike mentioned in terms of the overall impact on subs with -- how that kind of impact, that will be negative in terms of broadband, but when you look at the underlying business, I think we're. Around the same as where we were in Q3, the conditions are similar in that regard.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 10, "uuid": "cea2302c-b75e-4556-9f70-3c9194ba8c29", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So, in terms of fiber and terms of DOCSIS that we have in state, I think we have all the benefits of DOCSIS, the roadmap that we have and that -- in terms of the customer experience, in terms of multi-gig speeds that are symmetrical and the roadmap that we have, I don't really see a difference.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 10, "uuid": "cea2302c-b75e-4556-9f70-3c9194ba8c29", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: And by the way, we build a lot of fiber into our network today. And we were able with this architecture to tether-in fiber to be able to serve into use directly where needed. And so, we just have the flexibility within DOCSIS to pull fiber deeper as needed. And so, we actually provide a significant amount of fiber today already. But we really don't need to, it minimizes.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 10, "uuid": "cea2302c-b75e-4556-9f70-3c9194ba8c29", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: As I mentioned to Doug earlier, the need to change out a bunch of CapEx. And -- but I really like the roadmap to get to multi-gig symmetrical over the long run and to me that puts us right there. And do it in a ubiquitous way where other network providers are having to pick and choose how they get to certain communities. We serve every community with our every tier of broadband that we have.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 5, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 10, "uuid": "cea2302c-b75e-4556-9f70-3c9194ba8c29", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: [Speech Overlap], operator, next question please.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Marci Ryvicker", "section_number": 11, "uuid": "71da07e4-13b3-4440-bfeb-380c8de75f01", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President, Investor Relations at Comcast"}

section.text: Yes, hi. Let's talk about wireless, if we could, a bit. There have been reports that you've been pretty aggressively deploying strand-mounted small cells to offload traffic. I'm wondering if you could just talk a little bit about your experience thus far with traffic offload. It's still today mostly on Wi-Fi, but what you're thinking in terms of how much traffic can be offloaded?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Craig Moffett", "section_number": 13, "uuid": "d9e8d9a4-0f8a-41f2-bfac-06656cd96ef1", "speaker_title": "Analyst at MoffettNathanson"}

section.text: And is there the potential for something broader than just the CBRS strategy with getting some of your own mid-band spectrum to try to offload significantly more traffic, and just what you think the margins of that business could ultimately look like?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Craig Moffett", "section_number": 13, "uuid": "d9e8d9a4-0f8a-41f2-bfac-06656cd96ef1", "speaker_title": "Analyst at MoffettNathanson"}

section.text: Hey, Craig, Dave. So, let me start with where we're at right now with mobile and I'll talk about spectrum. We really like our trajectory in mobile. Obviously, we had a record-setting net-add quarter. And so, we like our capital-light approach. We like our position what we're able to do competitively, how we surround broadband with mobile, we get to play offense and we also get to package mobile with business services. Business services in small business is in the market now with mobile and having -- it's early but having great success out-of-the gates with that.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 14, "uuid": "f6fab8ca-3a72-40b1-b3c5-c5795ffc65c6", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So, when you combine By the Gig with new unlimited pricing that we have and it compare against the telephone companies, we can help customers save up to 50% in some cases. So it's -- we're well-positioned to compete with mobile today. But as I said, so we really like our position, the capital-light that we have, but we do view providing enhanced 5G connectivity and service areas where we have a high concentration of traffic as a very good potential opportunity.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 14, "uuid": "f6fab8ca-3a72-40b1-b3c5-c5795ffc65c6", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So, we've always been opportunistic. Today, WiFi is a part of how we look at managing our network. Most of the traffic goes over WiFi today. So, we look at the spectrum, whether it's CBRS or a 600-megahertz spectrum, as a good opportunity.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 14, "uuid": "f6fab8ca-3a72-40b1-b3c5-c5795ffc65c6", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So, there's nothing new really to talk about but we're testing. And we've talked about that before. We are working closely with Charter on modeling out the potential in these high dense traffic areas and what the savings could be. But no new news at this point, Craig, in terms of specific modeling. But we do look at as a potential opportunity down the road.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 14, "uuid": "f6fab8ca-3a72-40b1-b3c5-c5795ffc65c6", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: Thanks, Craig. Operator, next question please.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Marci Ryvicker", "section_number": 15, "uuid": "dab0aa7c-23f9-4228-83c9-fdb7fb4f370a", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President, Investor Relations at Comcast"}

section.text: Yeah, thanks for taking the question. So, you mentioned during your prepared remarks that for now you would expect that broadband ARPU growth would be the primary driver of overall broadband revenue growth. We've definitely got a little pushback from investors on that. They look at a more competitive market and households having lots of other pressures in their budgets in an inflationary environment. And so, what gives you confidence that you can sustain a profile of ARPU growth? How do you think that's going to break down between rate increases or up-selling or maybe something else? Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brett Feldman", "section_number": 17, "uuid": "e6d6d255-1326-4b32-a2bf-44293303e17c", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Goldman Sachs"}

section.text: Well, good question, and that -- part of it is our results. And you look at our results consistently that we've had in a very competitive environment, we've been dealing with very intense competitive activity for a long-time now. We've had fiber overbuild now over -- just over 40%, new competitive entrants and so, we've been able to -- and part of the reason why I think we do perform well and we have a balanced approach in terms of share and ARPU, is we serve every segment and we break it down by every segment.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 18, "uuid": "ec038c05-2ecc-4263-b920-0cd2566a936e", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So, we had healthy ARPU growth of 3.7% in Q3. And if we look at the opportunities to focus on tier mix as an opportunity, so starting with HSD only and then how we package and we surround again, we leverage mobile to do some of the lifting in terms of value and focusing on broadband ARPU there. We take a very balanced approach towards rates. We do have rate increases that we manage through. And we've had -- segmentation is part of our acquisition plan but it's also part of our retention plan. We have -- we model out retention opportunities by segment.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 18, "uuid": "ec038c05-2ecc-4263-b920-0cd2566a936e", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: And so, we've been very disciplined I think in terms of all these things. And so, it's an opportunity for us to drive both share and balanced ARPU growth. We've been doing it over a very long time. And we anticipate competition beat very substantial and -- but we also look at the roadmap that we have and being able to leverage mobile and other services. And so, we're -- we like our position. We've always taken a balanced approach towards ARPU and share.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 18, "uuid": "ec038c05-2ecc-4263-b920-0cd2566a936e", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: And just one other point to add. Long-term or longer-term, I continue to believe broadband is so critical, it's such an important dynamic part of our society and it's changing all the time. And people want the best, and the best is experience, it's speed, it's innovation its service, and that's what we're really focused on and we've been that way and. I think that's why we're -- have the number-one position today and we want to retain that.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "12bc0add-794d-4d3f-9b69-f8e8131f9bd3", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brett Feldman", "section_number": 20, "uuid": "68fb98c4-7a34-41ec-87d6-d433545db918", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Goldman Sachs"}

section.text: Thanks, Brett. Operator, next question please.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Marci Ryvicker", "section_number": 21, "uuid": "37b104b4-19e3-4a3c-b7ca-7e2cdb84f87c", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President, Investor Relations at Comcast"}

section.text: Thanks, and good morning. Just picking -- in the Cable business, if you look at the pace of video revenue, would you expect the current pace of video cord-cutting to continue at this level? And how much of the video losses that you're experiencing are simply a function of changing customer preferences for consumption relative to the elasticity from the pricing initiatives to offset the higher programming costs?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Rollins", "section_number": 23, "uuid": "c8ed7432-8d83-4d12-b39a-9bee1c5742a8", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Citi"}

section.text: Sorry, this is, Dave I anticipate that the changing nature of video to continue. We'd anticipated it. We've looked at this. We've been able to manage through it. And the focus on multiple growth drivers for us in terms of broadband business services, mobile -- but we also have looked at video as a broad platform opportunity. So yes, we've had -- the fluid nature of video putting pressure on the more mature tiers video service, but we've also offset a substantial part of that through flex.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "21a6cdfc-30f1-48de-b339-d7e355ebb2e3", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: We've invested in the ability to do smart TV things, the joint venture with Charter is an opportunity. So, we view video as an opportunity long term and as a platform, so we will continue to focus on that. And I think that will balance both things. But we've navigated through I think this before but I don't see it changing.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "21a6cdfc-30f1-48de-b339-d7e355ebb2e3", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: Thanks, Mike. Operator, next question, please.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Marci Ryvicker", "section_number": 25, "uuid": "8e0e6a6e-15d8-4ab4-a8a2-ef1fc20d5e25", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President, Investor Relations at Comcast"}

section.text: Questions, one on Cable and one on NBCU. On Cable, you talked like I guess it was about 9 years ago when you introduced or announced the Comcast Technology Center. Can you talk about the progress you've made in making Comcast a leading hub of innovation and how your view of Comcast position, I think you called it like unique cross-section of media and technology, how has that changed over time evolved?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jessica Reif Ehrlich", "section_number": 27, "uuid": "8e35f639-a7b8-49c9-954a-7c935d2a81d0", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America Securities"}

section.text: And then on NBCU, I can't believe you haven't got questions really. But what are the long-term aspirations for Peacock, let's say, over the next 3 years to 5 years? What do you think it will look like? And can you talk about on Theme Parks, the advanced bookings or visibility? Are international visitors coming back yet? Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jessica Reif Ehrlich", "section_number": 27, "uuid": "8e35f639-a7b8-49c9-954a-7c935d2a81d0", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Bank of America Securities"}

section.text: Yes, we'll take -- this is, Jeff, Jessica, hi. I was hoping to get no question, so you broke my streak here. We're going to do in reverse order a little bit here. So in the Theme Park business record quarter in the third quarter, first quarter ever profitability in Beijing. And despite the economic uncertainty that you see elsewhere in the economy, we're seeing no effects of that right now in the Theme Parks, either in terms of our performance -- our actual performance or our bookings going forward.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jeff Shell", "section_number": 28, "uuid": "e2825a92-efaf-4ce4-abb7-69ee53516a32", "speaker_title": "Chief Executive Officer, NBCUniversal at Comcast"}

section.text: Florida is really strong. Hollywood's really strong. Japan really ended the quarter pretty strong. So, it kind of defies logic a little bit, but part of it is based on the investments Brian outlined in his opening are really paying off. So, Theme Park business is really strong and we're seeing no weakness there.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jeff Shell", "section_number": 28, "uuid": "e2825a92-efaf-4ce4-abb7-69ee53516a32", "speaker_title": "Chief Executive Officer, NBCUniversal at Comcast"}

section.text: As far as Peacock, our long-term aspirations on Peacock is for it to be -- to balance out our overall Media business. I think we've said all along that we -- our strategy in streaming is different than some of the premiums SVOD players like Netflix and Disney Plus. We view it as a part of our business. We manage it as one. We make decisions on programming as one. We sell advertising across the business as one. And as viewership shifts from linear to Peacock, we want Peacock to get to a level on a scale that that causes our business to be balanced as consumer sentiments and advertiser sediments change. And very pleased with our performance in this quarter, over $15 million. And we're right on track for what we expected to do as we've built that business.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Jeff Shell", "section_number": 28, "uuid": "e2825a92-efaf-4ce4-abb7-69ee53516a32", "speaker_title": "Chief Executive Officer, NBCUniversal at Comcast"}

section.text: Okay, Dave, why don't you start on innovation and I'll add at the end? I think it's a great question.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 29, "uuid": "6974a317-be51-4d8c-8a02-d052cddfba55", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: It is, Jessica. So, this is -- this facility is a big part, not the only part but a big part, of how we think about long-term growth in innovation. And so, it really -- when you think about the teams over there, it culturally has changed the Company I think in terms of getting multiple groups, multiple teams, together to work on exciting projects that literally changes categories. And it -- if you really look at video, what we -- the question before, you go from, a, the linear video delivery system to a broad-based platform on multiple devices, this innovation happened with teams over there.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 30, "uuid": "e8210f15-f856-4004-8163-6dd1f00d6095", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: Being able to change broadband and to tie-in WiFi and to be able to do it for residential and business services and being able to deliver leading gateway devices in the roadmap that I talked about from mid-split to DOCSIS 4.0 happened over there.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 30, "uuid": "e8210f15-f856-4004-8163-6dd1f00d6095", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: In addition, the teams are changing the customer experience there as well and very focused on digital and what is possible to be able to help customers do everything over any device. And so, you look at where things are going, the Internet-of-Things being able -- devices and cameras being able to tie everything together, this is where these teams are focused on what's possible. So, it really has been game-changing in terms of what's the -- what we've been doing.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 30, "uuid": "e8210f15-f856-4004-8163-6dd1f00d6095", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: I'll just quickly add that post the pandemic, it's pretty exciting to walk-through the technology center and see people back at work and the energy and buzz. But I think of ourselves as a unique media and technology company, and we're focused on this sector. We view that our competition has changed. It includes the tech companies on the West Coast, and we have been looking to add to that scale.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 31, "uuid": "3ab19b76-9058-4dd1-b19b-ab68cc342b68", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: And I think we've made real progress in the last 12 months for things like our voice remote, which those who have it. whether you're using it for a streaming service or for video bundle or to now do other things and look up your account and any other aspects of how voice is deeply embedded in all of our products on Sky Glass globally. We now have between Sky, the new charter arrangement, previous deals with Cox and all of the Canadian operators are virtually all a roadmap for innovation. And I think as we look-forward to the Company, that's what's going to keep powering what Mike was talking about, the virtuous cycle of investment and return.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 31, "uuid": "3ab19b76-9058-4dd1-b19b-ab68cc342b68", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: So, we're all mindful of the economy and the world that we live in, but we have a pretty unique company and this is a big part of what. I think will make it more unique in the future, is to continue to try to innovate. So, glad you asked that question.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 31, "uuid": "3ab19b76-9058-4dd1-b19b-ab68cc342b68", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: Thanks, Jessica. Operator, next question, please.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Marci Ryvicker", "section_number": 32, "uuid": "8f3f0519-3c89-4f56-990e-490ee04a5952", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President, Investor Relations at Comcast"}

section.text: Hi, guys, thank you. And Mike, congratulations. Again, we've danced around it a little bit, but Brian, I want to ask about your sort of vision of the video ecosystem, because we see this linear acceleration to the downside. Peacock is growing, but Comcast and Charter and I think Cox customers get that for free now. So, maybe, Brian, talk about where the video ecosystem is growing and how the Company shifts the way to make money there?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Philip Cusick", "section_number": 34, "uuid": "4bd96093-7e5a-4cfb-a8a3-a5a8fd843549", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JP Morgan"}

section.text: And Jeff, remind us what success is in Peacock, paying and subs in MAUs over-time, and how you sort of balance that media -- business model overall. Is that fair?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Philip Cusick", "section_number": 34, "uuid": "4bd96093-7e5a-4cfb-a8a3-a5a8fd843549", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JP Morgan"}

section.text: Very fair. I think let me just start and I'll let my colleagues join in. The way we're trying to manage the Company, and we said this several years ago, which was a shift, was we saw change coming and we tried to think like a customer and think like the consumer. And we've learned -- I've at least -- think I've tried to learn from others' successes with that mentality. And the consumers -- many consumers didn't want the big video package. And so, what it -- we can fight that or we can try to embrace it.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 35, "uuid": "064361b2-e126-4016-899e-8183d1e66ef4", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: And so, our leadership in broadband was the first evidence of, okay, let's try to embrace it. Let's put Netflix on X1 going back several years and more people I think in a Comcast market view Netflix via X1 than any other device. I think that's still relatively true. Dave, you can comment on that. Our voice remote integrated all of Netflix's content. Then along came many others, let's just jump to Apple most recently. I think we have the best integration in the world of Apple TV Plus on our consumer devices.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 35, "uuid": "064361b2-e126-4016-899e-8183d1e66ef4", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: Over on the content side at NBCUniversal, that change allowed us to create content for Netflix or Amazon or Apple and many others. We own a third of Hulu, so when we bought the company all of our content was committed to Hulu in the streaming -- much of our content. We've -- as we've discussed that relationships in -- change and much of it is now back on Peacock. And Peacock has only been out there for a couple of years and super successful and a great quarter, and congratulations to all of NBCUniversal and the Peacock team for the results this quarter, in my opinion. And we came up with a different model since we were starting at a different time, an ad-centric, low-cost to the consumer.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 35, "uuid": "064361b2-e126-4016-899e-8183d1e66ef4", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: So again, it's back thinking from the consumers' perspective how do we fit-in and how do we do so in a profitable, long-term, value-creating way. And so, the results you're seeing this quarter -- I mean if you look at last year, last year was our best year in EBITDA and our best year in EPS in 60 years Comcast has been in business, and we're on pace to do better in this year than last year. So, I think that we have a good model but it starts with thinking from the customer.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 35, "uuid": "064361b2-e126-4016-899e-8183d1e66ef4", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: And so, the shift in video, we got to a place where we're actually somewhat indifferent. So, what the consumer prefers, we want to be for the customer and then if they're now taking our mobile product, they're getting an even better value and if they're taking Peacock, they're getting an even continued relationship with NBC if they've changed how they're consuming. So, I think we're in a very unique playing offense in a very changing world in a way that continues to yield great results for the Company.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 5, "speaker": "Brian L. Roberts", "section_number": 35, "uuid": "064361b2-e126-4016-899e-8183d1e66ef4", "speaker_title": "Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Comcast"}

section.text: Yes, let me jump in, Brian, and I'll take your question on Peacock. So if you kind of go to 30,000 feet and look at the NBCUniversal business, the business that our core is producing content and if you look at this quarter alone, most successful profitable quarter in the history of the movie business, we -- our kind of movie business is second to none right now, our TV business has expanded dramatically, we saw as Brian said to others in addition to ourselves, our news division is second and our sports division is doing really great.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 36, "uuid": "dcf924b2-5977-4a7c-a5d9-fb4c10409cb8", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: And so, if you want to -- if you have a great content business, the way you maximize your returns is having platforms where you can have the flexibility to put your content on your own platforms and move it around to give you content the best chance of success. And we've had that over the years.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 36, "uuid": "dcf924b2-5977-4a7c-a5d9-fb4c10409cb8", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So, when you look at Peacock, what is the definition of success? It's really two things. One is taking that ecosystem that I just talked about and giving yourself in addition to your platform, which allows you more flexibility to maximize the return of your content, both in terms of allowing it to -- sure to have a better chance of being a hit or a movie to have a better return when you can move it around and have the right platform for the right piece of content. So, we want to get Peacock to a scale where we're fairly indifferent between content going on linear and content going on Peacock and having them -- the best platform out there, and we think we're well on our way to that.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 36, "uuid": "dcf924b2-5977-4a7c-a5d9-fb4c10409cb8", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: The second is just the traditional way you look at any investment, which is that we're investing a lot of money in Peacock and we view the fact that it's going to get to a level of profitability that will generate a return on that investment that will add value to shareholders. And this quarter it makes us more confident that we're along that trajectory. So, those are really the two measures.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 36, "uuid": "dcf924b2-5977-4a7c-a5d9-fb4c10409cb8", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: Thanks, Phil. Operator, we have time for one last question.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Marci Ryvicker", "section_number": 37, "uuid": "6188e43f-8d5f-4f63-b99d-09667e58d267", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President, Investor Relations at Comcast"}

section.text: Great, thank you. Maybe last one for Dave, back on the Cable side. The business market is certainly emerging as one of the drivers of revenue growth in that segment and it sounds like you guys are having some real success across small and medium enterprise markets. Just any commentary on sort of penetration levels in those markets to give us a sense of how much runway you have and then commentary on sort of the profitability of that business segment versus the rest of the Cable business. Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "John Hodulik", "section_number": 39, "uuid": "89348e95-e071-470a-ad08-3c72049c1eef", "speaker_title": "Analyst at UBS"}

section.text: Hey, John, so look, we -- just as Brian mentioned, one of the core growth drivers for us is business services, I'm really glad you asked about it because the team is doing an outstanding job. When you look at our performance in business services, we outperformed all competitors and peers. As I said, it really is a very interesting, long-term consistent performance from our Group. Bill Stemper and the team has really done a terrific job generating. And we're generating, now approaching $10 billion in annual revenue and have a great opportunity to grow further. So high margins, and you look at the addressable marketplace, we're serving less -- we have 20 -- less than 20% share of addressable marketplace of $50 billion in our footprint.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 40, "uuid": "bf411fb3-db48-4ca5-b12b-da273fa5afbc", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: So, you break it down, SMB, we are -- along with share and very focused on that, but we're also very focused on the corollary to what we talked about early residential is ARPU and we focus both share and revenue, and with WiFi -- enhanced WiFi for small-business customers, wireless backup cameras, security and now mobile, so we have a strong portfolio to go up against the telephone companies with, and it's working, so very balanced approach towards growth.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 40, "uuid": "bf411fb3-db48-4ca5-b12b-da273fa5afbc", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: In mid-market and enterprise, it is a key long-term growth opportunity and there it's more sophisticated applications like SD-WAN, enhanced security and UCaaS, the advanced unified messaging. So -- and Masergy has just been a terrific addition, giving us international scale in being able to help us with certain applications. So, no specifics beyond that, but it really is a very important part of our business and they're doing a terrific job.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "David N. Watson", "section_number": 40, "uuid": "bf411fb3-db48-4ca5-b12b-da273fa5afbc", "speaker_title": "President & Chief Executive Officer, Comcast Cable at Comcast"}

section.text: Thanks, John, and thank you, everyone, for joining us this morning.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Marci Ryvicker", "section_number": 41, "uuid": "a8a83b2c-e1fb-4cec-b770-195a93dafd57", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President, Investor Relations at Comcast"}

title: Q&A for CMCSA (Comcast) on 10/27/22 8:30 AM ET
